text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus according to the command of God our Savior and of Christ Jesus our hope,
speaker: Narrator

text: to Timothy, my true child in the faith. Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as I urged you when I traveled to Macedonia, remain in Ephesus, so that you may instruct certain people not to teach other doctrine,
speaker: Narrator

text: and not to pay attention to myths and endless genealogies, which cause useless speculations rather than God’s plan that is by faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the goal of our instruction is love from a pure heart and a good conscience and a faith without hypocrisy,
speaker: Narrator

text: from which some have deviated, and have turned away into fruitless discussion,
speaker: Narrator

text: wanting to be teachers of the law, although they do not understand either the things which they are saying or the things concerning which they are speaking confidently.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we know that the law is good, if anyone makes use of it lawfully,
speaker: Narrator

text: knowing this, that the law is not given for a righteous person but for the lawless and rebellious, for the ungodly and sinners, for the unholy and totally worldly, for the one who kills his father and the one who kills his mother, for murderers,
speaker: Narrator

text: sexually immoral people, homosexuals, kidnappers, liars, perjurers, and whatever else is opposed to sound teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: according to the glorious gospel of the blessed God that I was entrusted with.
speaker: Narrator

text: I give thanks to the one who strengthens me, Christ Jesus our Lord, because he considered me faithful, placing me into ministry,
speaker: Narrator

text: although I was formerly a blasphemer and a persecutor and a violent man, but I was shown mercy because I acted ignorantly in unbelief,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the grace of our Lord abounded with the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: The saying is trustworthy and worthy of all acceptance: Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom I am the foremost.
speaker: Narrator

text: But because of this I was shown mercy, in order that in me foremost, Christ Jesus might demonstrate his total patience, for an example for those who are going to believe in him for eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to the King of the ages, immortal, invisible, to the only God, be honor and glory forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am setting before you this instruction, Timothy my child, in accordance with the prophecies spoken long ago about you, in order that by them you may fight the good fight,
speaker: Narrator

text: having faith and a good conscience, which some, because they have rejected these, have suffered shipwreck concerning their faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: among whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have handed over to Satan, in order that they may be taught not to blaspheme.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I urge first of all that petitions, prayers, requests, and thanksgiving be made on behalf of all people,
speaker: Narrator

text: on behalf of kings and all those who are in authority, in order that we may live a tranquil and quiet life in all godliness and dignity.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is good and acceptable before God our Savior,
speaker: Narrator

text: who wants all people to be saved and to come to a knowledge of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is one God and one mediator between God and human beings, the man Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who gave himself a ransom for all, the testimony at the proper time,
speaker: Narrator

text: for which I was appointed a herald and an apostle—I am speaking the truth, I am not lying—a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I want the men in every place to pray, lifting up holy hands without anger and dispute.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise also the women should adorn themselves in appropriate clothing, with modesty and self-control, not with braided hair and gold jewelry or pearls or expensive clothing,
speaker: Narrator

text: but with good deeds which are fitting for women who profess godliness.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman must learn in quietness with all submission.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I do not permit a woman to teach or to exercise authority over a man, but to remain quiet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Adam was formed first, then Eve,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Adam was not deceived, but the woman, because she was deceived, came into transgression.
speaker: Narrator

text: But she will be saved through the bearing of children, if she continues in faith and love and holiness with self-control.
speaker: Narrator

text: The saying is trustworthy: if anyone aspires to supervision, he desires a good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the overseer must be irreproachable, the husband of one wife, temperate, self-controlled, respectable, hospitable, skillful in teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: not addicted to wine, not a violent person, but gentle, peaceable, not loving money,
speaker: Narrator

text: managing his own household well, having children in submission with all dignity
speaker: Narrator

text: (but if someone does not know how to manage his own household, how will he take care of the church of God?),
speaker: Narrator

text: not newly converted, lest he become conceited and fall into the condemnation of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he must also have a good testimony from those outside, in order that he may not fall into disgrace and the trap of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deacons likewise must be dignified, not insincere, not devoted to much wine, not fond of dishonest gain,
speaker: Narrator

text: holding the mystery of the faith with a clear conscience,
speaker: Narrator

text: and these also must be tested first; then let them serve if they are above reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: The wives likewise must be dignified, not slanderous, temperate, faithful in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deacons must be husbands of one wife, managing their children and their own households well.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who have served well acquire a good standing for themselves, and great boldness in the faith that is in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am writing these things to you, hoping to come to you in a short time.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I am delayed, I am writing in order that you may know how one must conduct oneself in the household of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and mainstay of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And most certainly, great is the mystery of godliness:
Who was revealed in the flesh,
    was vindicated by the Spirit,
was seen by angels,
    was proclaimed among the Gentiles,
was believed on in the world,
    was taken up in glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Spirit explicitly says that in the last times some will depart from the faith, paying attention to deceitful spirits and teachings of demons,
speaker: Narrator

text: by the hypocrisy of liars, who are seared in their own conscience,
speaker: Narrator

text: who forbid marrying and insist on abstaining from foods that God created for sharing in with thankfulness by those who believe and who know the truth,
speaker: Narrator

text: because everything created by God is good and nothing is to be rejected if it is received with thankfulness,
speaker: Narrator

text: for it is made holy by the word of God and prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: By teaching these things to the brothers, you will be a good servant of Christ Jesus, trained in the words of the faith and of the good teaching that you have followed faithfully.
speaker: Narrator

text: But reject those worthless myths told by elderly women, and train yourself for godliness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the training of the body is somewhat profitable, but godliness is profitable for everything, because it holds promise for the present life and for the life to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: The statement is trustworthy and deserving of complete acceptance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to this end we labor and suffer reproach, because we have put our hope in the living God, who is the Savior of all people, especially of believers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Command these things and teach them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let no one look down on your youth, but be an example for the believers in word, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until I come, pay attention to the public reading, to exhortation, to teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not neglect the gift that is in you, that was granted to you through prophecy with the laying on of hands by the council of elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Practice these things. Be diligent in these things, in order that your progress may be evident to everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fix your attention on yourself and on your teaching. Continue in them, for by doing this you will save both yourself and those who hear you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not rebuke an older man, but appeal to him as a father, younger men as brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: older women as mothers, younger women as sisters, with all purity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor widows who are truly widows.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if any widow has children or grandchildren, they must learn to show profound respect for their own household first, and to pay back recompense to their parents, for this is pleasing in the sight of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the widow who is one truly, and is left alone, has put her hope in God and continues in her petitions and prayers night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the one who lives for sensual pleasure is dead even though she lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And command these things, in order that they may be irreproachable.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if someone does not provide for his own relatives, and especially the members of his household, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let a widow be put on the list if she is not less than sixty years old, the wife of one husband,
speaker: Narrator

text: being well-attested by good works, if she has brought up children, if she has shown hospitality, if she has washed the feet of the saints, if she has helped those who are oppressed, if she has devoted herself to every good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: But refuse younger widows, for whenever their physical desires lead them away from Christ, they want to marry,
speaker: Narrator

text: thus incurring condemnation because they have broken their former pledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the same time also, going around from house to house, they learn to be idle, and not only idle, but also gossipy and busybodies, saying the things that are not necessary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I want younger widows to marry, to bear children, to manage a household, to give the adversary no opportunity for reproach.
speaker: Narrator

text: For already some have turned away and followed after Satan.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any believing woman has widows, she must help them, and the church must not be burdened, in order that it may help those who are truly widows.
speaker: Narrator

text: The elders who lead well must be considered worthy of double honor, especially those who labor by speaking and teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the scripture says, “You must not muzzle an ox while it is threshing,” and “The worker is worthy of his wages.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not accept an accusation against an elder except on the evidence of two or three witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Reprove those who sin in the presence of all, in order that the rest also may experience fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: I testify solemnly before God and Christ Jesus and the elect angels that you observe these things without prejudice, doing nothing according to partiality.
speaker: Narrator

text: Lay hands on no one hastily, and do not participate in the sins of others. Keep yourself pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: (No longer drink only water, but use a little wine for your stomach and your frequent illnesses.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The sins of some people are evident, preceding them to judgment, but for some also they follow after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise also good works are evident, and those considered otherwise are not able to be hidden.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those who are under the yoke as slaves must regard their own masters as worthy of all honor, lest the name of God and the teaching be slandered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And those who have believing masters must not look down on them because they are brothers, but rather they must serve, because those who benefit by their service are believers and dearly loved.
Teach and encourage these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone teaches other doctrine and does not devote himself to the sound words of our Lord Jesus Christ and the teaching that is in accordance with godliness,
speaker: Narrator

text: he is conceited, understanding nothing, but having a morbid interest concerning controversies and disputes about words, from which come envy, strife, slanders, evil suspicions,
speaker: Narrator

text: constant wrangling by people of depraved mind and deprived of the truth, who consider godliness to be a means of gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: But godliness with contentment is a great means of gain.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we have brought nothing into the world, so that neither can we bring anything out.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if we have food and clothing, with these things we will be content.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those who want to be rich fall into temptation and a trap and many foolish and harmful desires, which plunge those people into ruin and destruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the love of money is a root of all evil, by which some, because they desire it, have gone astray from the faith and have pierced themselves with many pains.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you, O man of God, flee from these things, and pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patient endurance, gentleness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fight the good fight of the faith; take hold of the eternal life to which you were called, and confessed the good confession in the presence of many witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: I command you, in the sight of God who gives life to all things and Christ Jesus who testified the good confession before Pontius Pilate,
speaker: Narrator

text: that you observe the commandment without fault, irreproachable until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: which he will make known in his own time, the blessed and only Sovereign, the King of those who reign as kings and Lord of those who rule as lords,
speaker: Narrator

text: the one who alone possesses immortality, who lives in unapproachable light, whom no human being has seen nor is able to see, to whom be honor and eternal power. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Command those who are rich in this present age not to be proud and not to put their hope in the uncertainty of riches, but in God, who provides us all things richly for enjoyment,
speaker: Narrator

text: to do good, to be rich in good works, to be generous, sharing freely,
speaker: Narrator

text: storing up for themselves a good foundation for the future, in order that they may take hold of what is truly life.
speaker: Narrator

text: O Timothy, guard what has been entrusted to you. Turn away from pointless empty talk and contradictions of what is falsely called knowledge,
speaker: Narrator

text: which some, by professing it, have deviated concerning the faith. Grace be with you all.
speaker: Narrator
